p: The ability of a riboswitch to respond to multiple chemically similar compounds may be fairly common. Examples of this behavior include the glmS riboswitch that can interact with both activating and inhibitory metabolites ( 51), the class-II cobalamin riboswitches, some of which bind the biologically active forms of B 12 with near equal affinities ( 7) and THF riboswitches that bind to a spectrum of reduced folates ( 52, 53). This behavior may enable these riboswitches to respond to metabolic and physiological states of the cell that cannot be readily sensed by interacting with a single compound within a pool of related metabolites.
